text: Instruction Synonym — Jumpcondition — Description jmp Label 1 Direct jump jmp +Operand 1 Indirect jump je Label jz z Equal / zero jne Label jnz -z Not equal / not zero js Label sF Negative jns Label -sF Nonnegative jg Label jnle -(SF-OF)&-ZF Greater (signed >) jge Label ol ~(SF ~ OF) Greater or equal (signed >=) j1 Label jnge sF-OF Less (signed <) jle Label jng (SF-0F) | ZF Less or equal (signed <=) ja Label jnbe ~CF & ~ZF Above (unsigned >) jae Label job ~cF Above or equal (unsigned >=) jb Label jnae c Below (unsigned <) jbe Label jna CF | ZF Below or equal (unsigned <=) Figure 3.15 The jump instructions. These instructions jump to a labeled destination when the jump condition holds. Some instructions have “synonyms,” alternate names for the same machine instruction.
